content:
Check:
  all:
    - name: --STDTC
      operator: empty
    - name: --STDY
      operator: empty
Core:
  Id: CDISC.SENDIG.291
  Version: '1'
  Status: Draft
Description: Either --STDTC or --STDY must be populated.
Outcome:
  Message: Neither --STDTC nor --STDY is populated
Rule Type: Record Data
Sensitivity: Record
Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC
    Standards:
      - Name: SENDIG
        Version: '3.1'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SENDIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: '291'
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: In general, all domains based on the three general
                  observation classes should have at least one Timing variable. In
                  the Events or Interventions general observation class, this could
                  be the start date of the event or intervention…This domain should
                  contain one record per constant dosing interval per subject per
                  administration site (as identified in FOCID). A constant dosing
                  interval is sponsor defined and represents a specific period of
                  time during which a subject was treated with a specific lot at a
                  constant dose level.
                Document: IG v3.1
                Section: 4.4|6.1.1.1
Scope:
  Classes:
    Include:
      - INTERVENTIONS
  Domains:
    Include:
      - EX

Citations.Cited_Guidance: In general, all domains based on the three general observation classes should have at least one Timing variable. In the Events or Interventions general observation class, this could be the start date of the event or intervention…This domain should contain one record per constant dosing interval per subject per administration site (as identified in FOCID). A constant dosing interval is sponsor defined and represents a specific period of time during which a subject was treated with a specific lot at a constant dose level.
